0108-d-03-16-10-URR.Narrative:
UNION RAILROAD CREW #76C-3 WAS USING 4 UNIT CONSIST (URR-15 19-24-30) WITH LOCOMOTIVE URR #30 AS THELEAD UNIT; CREW WAS HAULING 90 LOADS OF ORE AND CABOOSE C-107 SOUTH ON THE SOUTHBOUND MAIN TRACK DIVERGING SOUTH WEST OFF THE MAIN TRACK ONTO THE DEXTER LEAD AT THE 111 POWER SWITCH SPEED WAS 7.3 MPH.  CREW WAS MOVING A MEDIUM APPROACH ASPECT AT SIGNAL 110 SIGNAL 
CONTROLS SOUTHWARD MOVEMENTS OVERTHE 111 SWITCH). URR 50C-3 CREW USING A TRIPPLE UNIT CONSIST (URR #16 LEAD UNIT) WAS 
HAULING 41 EMPTY SLAB CARS NORTH ON THE SOUTHBOUND MAIN TRACK APPROACHING A STOP INDICATION AT SIGNAL 112 (SIGNAL CONTRO
L NORTHWARD MOVEMENT OVER THE 111 SWITCH).  ENGINEER OF THE 50C-3 CREW FAILED TO STOP HISTRAIN AT SIGNAL 112 (SIGNAL 
DISPLAYING A STOP INDICATION).  WHILE TRAVELING AT 6 MPH LEAD LOCOMOTIVE (URR #16) COLLIDED WITH ORE TRAIB AT 76C-3 THAT WAS DIVERGING OFF THE MAIN TRACK ONTO THE DEXTERLEAD.  ORE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING 7.3 MPH.  URR 50C-3 CREWS LEAD LOCOMOTIVE URR #16 STRUCK THE 7TH THROUGH 10TH CARS OF THE ORE TRAIN.  AS RESULT OF THE COLLISION, THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF LOCOMOTIVE CAB (ENGINEER SIDE) OF 50C-3 CREW LOCOMOTIVE (URR #16) WAS PARTIALLY TORN AWAY EJECTING ENGINEER (DECEASED) AND DERAILING LOCOMOTIVE.  3 CARS OF ORE, TWO OF WHICH DERAILED WERE TORN OPEN, SPILLING ORE. THEFOLLOWING IS A LIST OF CREW 76C-3 ORE TRAIN CARS DAMAGED AND/OR DERAILED: BLE 65977 7TH CAR DAMAGED), BLE 66038 8TH CAR (DAMAGED), BLE 65659 9TH CAR (DERAILED), BLE 65653 10TH CAR (DERAILED), BLE 6572

664850-d-03-22-10-GTW.Narrative: M38461-22 WAS OPERATING THROUGH ANN ARBOR/DIANN WYE AT 10 MPH WHEN AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY APPLICATION WAS EXPERIENCED.  UPON INSPECTION, THE CONDUCTOR FOUND THE 55TH-57TH CARS, UTLX 903214 - NAHX 99779 - UTLX 902471 DERAILED UPRIGHT ON THE MAIN.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT UTLX 903214 HAD DERAILED AT MP 19.8 ON THE ANN ARBOR RAILROAD, THE JOURNAL, BEARING RACE AND ADAPTER FOR THE R3 WHEELS WAS LOCATED AT MP 19.1.  THE TRAIN HAD TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY .5 MILE ACROSS THE ANN ARBORRAILROAD WHEN THEY ENTERED THE FLAT ROCK SUBDIVISION AT MP 39.5 AND STOPPED AT MP 39.5.  THE CREW RECEIVED AN EMERGENCY CALL FROM THE ANN ARBOR'S DISPATCHER SECONDS AFTER THE TRAIN HAD GONE INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CAUSE HAS BEEN DETERMINED TO BE A BURNT JOURNAL ON UTLX 903214.  BOTH THE ANN ARBOR RAILROAD AND GRAND TRUCK SUSTAINED TRACK DAMAGE.  THERE WAS NO HAZARDOUS LEAK OR EXPOSURE.  INITIAL DAMAGE ESTIMATE PROVIDED BY ANN ARBOR RAILROAD - $10,000

663207-d-03-05-10-IC.Narrative: L58471-05 WAS SWITCHING ON THE SOUTH END OF BATON ROUGE YARD.  THE BRAKEMAN WAS STANDING AT THE #6 SWITCH WHEN THE CONDUCTOR LET 1 CAR GO TOWARDS #6.  THE CAR TRAVELED UP INTO #6 TRACK AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE STANDING CARS THAT WERE ABOUT 6 CARS DEEP INTO TRACK.  THE BRAKEMAN LOOKED AND HEARD THECARS HIT AND THOUGHT THAT THEY HAD COUPLED AND TOLD THE CONDUCTOR TO LET THEM GO-WHICH WAS THE NEXT3 CARS IN THE CUT GOING TO #9 TRACK. THE BRAKEMAN THREW THE #6 -7 SWITCH BACK FOR THE LEAD AND HEADED SOUTH TOWARD THE SPLIT LEAD SWITCH ACCOUNT THE NEXT CARS TO BE SWITCHED WERE TO GO TO #3 TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR KICKED THE NEXT 3 CARS DOWN THE LEAD TOWARDS #9 TRACK AND GATX 30443 DID NOT COUPLE IN#6 TRACK AND ROLLED BACK SOUTH CORNERING THE CARS (UTLX 96063) TRAVELING DOWN THE LEAD TO #9 TRACK.BOTH WERE HAZARDOUS LOADS, THERE WERE NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURES.  CREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERENEGATIVE.

WHILE RAIL SCIENCES DID NOT DEVELOP ANY EVIDENCE OF TRANSVERSE DEFECTS OR DETAIL FRACTURES, ONE OF THE FRACTURES IN THE HEAD OF THE NORTH RAIL IMMEDIATELY ADJACENT TO A WELD SHOWED SOME INDICATION OF WHEEL BATTER, INDICATING THAT IT MAY HAVE BEEN THEPOINT OF ORIGINATION OF THE DERAILMENT, BUT WAS LIKELY CAUSED BY THE SOFT ROADBED.  THIS PIECE OF RAIL DID EXHIBIT AN AREA OF FRACTURE ORIGINATION, AND WHILE FATIGUE AREAS ARE KNOWN TO DEVELOP NEXT TO WELDS, IN THIS CASE NO SUCH FATIGUE AREA COULD BE DISCERNED, ONLY THAT FAILURE ORIGINATED AT THISLOCATION.  RAIL = CWR

MRD0330103-d-03-30-10-IANR.Narrative: CREW WAS OPERATING ON MAIN TRACK IN A 10 MPH SPEED RESTRICTION. A DEPUTY SHERIFF WAITING AT A CROSSING NOTICED A SET OF WHEELS WAS DERAILED. HE IMMEDIATELY PHONED OUR DISPATCHER WHO IN TURN NOTIFIED THE CREW TO BRING THEIR TRAIN TO A STOP. DUE TO THE FACT THAT THEY WERE NOW MOVING OVER A STORAGE TRACK SWITCH, FIVE ADDITIONAL CARS WERE DERAILED. THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO HARMONIC ROCKAND ROLL. CONTRIBUTING TO THE CAUSE WAS THE FACT THAT THE ENGINEER WAS HANDLING THE TRAIN AT SPEEDSBETWEEN 10 MPH AND 14 MPH.
